clinical_study.brief_title: Obstructive Sleep Apnea, Retinal Vein Occlusion, Retinal Artery Occlusion
clinical_study.official_title: Obstructive Sleep Apnea, Retinal Vein Occlusion, Retinal Artery Occlusion

brief_summary.textblock: Obstructive sleep apnea is a common disorder linked to serious long-term adverse health consequences; such as hypertension, metabolic dysfunction, cardiovascular disease. Retinal vascular occlusion is related to many systemic illnesses especially hypertension. Obstructive sleep apnea is also related to vascular endothelial dysfunction and vascular endothelial growth factor elevation which causes vision threatening complications of retinal vascular occlusion. Therefore the relationship between obstructive sleep apnea and retinal vascular occlusion should be studied.

primary_outcome.time_frame: after finishing the tests with Watchpat-100
primary_outcome.description: Result Data of Watchpat-100 : apnea-hypopnea index(AHI)
Incidence of patients at risk for obstructive sleep apnea according to the Berlin questionnaire

primary_outcome.time_frame: after finishing the Epworth sleepiness sclae
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of patients with daytime sleepiness according to the Epworth sleepiness scale.

intervention.description: Watchpat 100 is a noninvasive portable sleep monitoring device which monitors peripheral arterial tone, pulse, oxygen saturation, snoring, and body position. Patient places one probe at his or her finger and another sensor at front of the chest and Watchpat 100 monitors the patient overnight.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Any patient who visits outpatient clinic and diagnosed as retinal vascular occlusion which occurred within recent 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any ocular disease other than retinal vascular occlusion (for example: floppy eyelid syndrome, uveitis, glaucoma, other retinal diseases)
- Patient who has difficulty answering the questionnaires or portable sleep monitoring
- Patient who refuses the study enroll
